metadata.titel_preek: Night of Shame, Night of Glory

kernfrasen: Jesus said to his little adopted family
brothers and sisters at the deepest level
Father in heaven offer his own life to us
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: THE CHURCH IS A FAMILY / GOD IS A FATHER

kernfrasen: give his life as a ransom for many
the free gift achieved for us
give us all the vitamins tomorrow
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SALVATION IS AN ECONOMIC TRANSACTION / GRACE IS A GIFT

kernfrasen: climactic battle against your Enemy and mine
no condemnation for those who are in Christ
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS A CRIME / GOD IS A JUDGE

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Preparing, tonight, to give us all the vitamins tomorrow.

doeldomein.theologisch_concept: The Benefits of the Cross / Grace

cognitieve_implicaties: The provider must lack so the recipient can have
theologische_implicaties: Grace as a substance given to the believer
onbedoelde_consequenties: Reduces the Cross to a nutritional supplement
Infantilizes the believer as a child needing pills

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher uses a specific narrative (Three Came Home) to re-activate the 'Grace as Gift' metaphor through a concrete, visceral story of survival.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully weaves the Relational (Family) and Juridical (Judgment) domains by framing the Judge as a Father and the 'ransom' as an act of familial love.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The transition from a family dinner/vitamin distribution to a 'climactic battle' is abrupt.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: A father providing for children entails peace/nurture; a soldier in battle entails violence/conflict.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher uses the concept of 'Adoption' to explain how the 'Sentence' of the Judge is handled by the 'Brother' (Jesus).

sterktes.beschrijving: The 'Vitamin' metaphor breathes new life into the dead metaphor of 'Grace as a Gift'.
sterktes.voorbeeld: He is preparing, tonight, to give us all the vitamins tomorrow.

risicos.beschrijving: Comparing the blood of Christ to vitamins may reduce the cosmic significance of the atonement to personal self-care.
risicos.voorbeeld: give us all the vitamins tomorrow
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation views the Eucharist as a spiritual 'boost' rather than a covenantal sacrifice.

sub_worlds: A Japanese prison camp (Three Came Home)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Strong emotional bridge to explain self-sacrifice.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Repeated use of 'brothers and sisters' and 'inner circle'.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Highlighting the 'blood and spittle and mockery and excrement'.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Perfectly aligns with Maundy Thursday (Mandatum/Love and Institution of Eucharist).

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Relational/Familial domain, which provides a warm, communal atmosphere. This is balanced by a sharp Juridical/Economic focus on 'ransom' and 'judgment' to maintain theological weight. The use of the 'Vitamin' metaphor is the cognitive pivot of the text.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'ransom' more explicitly to the 'prison camp' imagery used earlier.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Jesus pays the price to open the gates of the camp where we were held.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Bridge the two by describing the 'vitamins' as 'rations' for the soldier.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If sin is just a deficiency, there is no need for 'judgment'.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Ensure the 'vitamin' metaphor is clearly labeled as an illustration of 'grace' and not a definition of 'sin'.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To ground the 'new community' in something more stable than just family feelings.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of cognitive mapping that moves from the familiar (family) to the shocking (prison camp/excrement) to the theological (atonement).

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'vividness' of the prison camp story, CMT reveals how that story functions as a cognitive bridge to understand the mechanics of substitutionary atonement.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on learning styles, CMT shows how the preacher re-wires the hearer's neural mapping of 'God' from 'Judge' to 'Self-Sacrificing Parent'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies the 'Vitamin' metaphor as a potential risk for 'Therapeutic Reduction', which a standard homiletical analysis might miss.

appendices.notities: The preacher relies heavily on the 'Container' schema (In Christ, In the family, In the camp).
